text:
Created attachment 32313
[patch] Makefile.in

If apache 2.4 is build as package with "--enable-mpms-shared=all" and with cgi and cgid the user has to choose if cgi or cgid should be used in httpd.conf.

The patch wraps a <IfModule ...> line around the "LoadModule cgi(d)_module" line so in case both modules are enabled the resulting httpd.conf looks like this.

This works also in case MPM compiled into httpd or only one or none cgi module was chosen.

The patch should work for all *NIX platforms.

...
#LoadModule info_module libexec/apache24/mod_info.so
<IfModule !mpm_prefork_module>
#LoadModule cgid_module libexec/apache24/mod_cgid.so
</IfModule>
<IfModule mpm_prefork_module>
#LoadModule cgi_module libexec/apache24/mod_cgi.so
</IfModule>
#LoadModule dav_fs_module libexec/apache24/mod_dav_fs.so
...
creator: ohauer@gmx.de
rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
I changed the patch slightly for the case when only mod_cgid was build and the user had chosen the prefork MPM - which IMHO is allowed. I do first detect whether both modules, mod_cgi and mod_cgid are actually being build and only add the IfModule lines in that case.

Applied to trunk as r1652955 and proposed for 2.4.

Thanks for the contribution.
